cells.data:
Copernicus proposed heliocentric model BUT IT WAS WRONG
Planets don't move in perfect circles (they have slightly elliptical orbits)

Tycho Brahe made incredibly accurate observations of planetary motion (with his *naked eye*)

Kepler found the ellipses

#Kepler's Laws of Planetary Motion
1. The Sun is at one focus of an elliptical orbit of the planet (*perihelion* close; *aphelion* far; avg distance to Sun = semimajor axis)
2. A line connecting a planet to the Sun sweeps out equal areas in equal times
3.
